result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone L Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 5 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution is ordered to be paid to Associated Bank as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with Associated Bank listed in the Criminal Complaint.

records.addlTxt: Received and filed in court by the State.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tyrone L Rogers in court with attorney Kelsey Morin. 

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant's brother & mother presented a statement to the court.
  
Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  7 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision:  5 Years.
5 Days Credit 

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Associated Bank listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

RESTITUTION:  $11,009.00 (to be paid to Associated Bank  - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts) .

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant can be transferred to DCI - FORTHWITH.
